newsitem.title: USA: Middle Bay acquires Bison for $10 mln.
newsitem.headline: Middle Bay acquires Bison for $10 mln.

text.p: Middle Bay Oil Co Inc said Monday it was going ahead with an agreement to merge with Bison Energy Corp in a $10 million cash and stock deal.
The company said it will issue 1.2 million shares of its common stock and cancel 562,000 shares held by Bison for a net increase of 605,556 shares of its stock.
It also said it will pay $5.9 million in cash as part of the deal, which is set to close by February 28.
Kaiser-Francis Oil Co will provide it with the funds to complete the deal through a stock purchase agreement, it added.
The company said it would make Bison, an exploration and production company with oil and natural gas assets in Kansas and Oklahoma, into a wholly-owned subsidiary.
The merger will add 606,681 barrels of oil and natural gas liquids and 2.5 billion cubic feet of natural gas in Kansas to its reserves, it said.
The company said it would have total proved reserves of 2.0 million barrels of oil and natural gas liquids and 11.5 billion cubic feet of natural gas.
